Dear Ms. Smigelski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & ACT NO. 116: 722.118c License; issuance to specific person

Description department.
Sec. 8c. A license shall be issued to a specific person or
organization at a specific location, shall be nontransferable,
and shall remain the property of the department.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency did not notify DCWL when they
moved to a new address.
Investigation The Program Supervisor was interviewed face to face on
January 5, 2023. The Program Supervisor was informed of the
complaint. The Program Supervisor reported that the agency
moved locations in March 2022, from 711 West Chisholm Street in
Alpena to 600 Walnut Street, Alpena. The Program Supervisor
reported that the move had been planned for some time as the
new DHHS building on Walnut was being constructed. The
Program Supervisor referred me to the Chief Administrator.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
January 5, 2023, and March 2, 2023. The Chief Administrator
acknowledged that the agency had not notified DCWL of the move
from the Chisholm Street address to the current location at 600
Walnut Street. The Chief Administrator reported that she assumed
the position of Chief Administrator on December 6, 2021, and was
not aware of the need to report the change of location and thought
that occurred automatically in the system.
Analysis The Chief Administrator acknowledged that the agency had not
informed DCWL of the geographical move of the agency from the
Chisholm Street address to the Walnut Street address in March
2022.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
